problem: An average active person consumes about 2500 Cal a day. (a) What is this in joules? (b) What is this in kilowatt-hours? (c) If your power company charges about 10 ¢ per kilowatt-hour, how much would your energy cost per day if you bought it from the power company? Could you feed yourself on this much money per day?

steps.explanation: (c) Multiply by the utility rate to get daily cost; answer is far below real food costs.
steps.notations: Cost ≈ 2.9 kWh × $0.10 ≈ $0.29 per day → not enough to buy actual food
